name: João Barreto 0001
content: João Pedro Barreto — João Pedro Barreto | INESC-ID & Lisbon University I'm an associate professor at Instituto Superior Técnico (Universidade de Lisboa) and researcher of the Distributed Systems Group at INESC-ID. Current research interests: System Support for Persistent Memory, Exascale Computing,  Transactional Memory, Consistency and Replication (including Blockchain Consensus Protocols). I'm currently involved in the European joint Effort toward a Highly Productive Programming Environment for Heterogeneous Exascale Computing (EPEEC), an H2020 project. This year I'm teaching Introduction to Computer Architectures and Distributed Systems (undergrad. level). News May/2025: Really excited that our 6th Workshop on Heterogeneity and Memory Systems (HMEM 2025) will again be part of the SC conference. Please consider submitting (deadline: August 26th). Jan/2025: I'm part of the program committee of the 4th Workshop on Heterogeneous Composable and Disaggregated Systems, co-located with ASPLOS/EUROSYS 2025. Submission deadline: January 20, 2025. Dec/2024: Our paper "Better memory tiering, right from the first placement" was accepted in ICPE 2025. This is joint work between our team (Joao Póvoas, André Gonçalves, myself) with Huawei Poland. Sep/2024: João Póvoas received the Best Student Paper award at Inforum'24 for our paper: "Optimizing OS Support for Dynamic Page Placement in Heterogeneous Memory Architectures". Congratulations, João! Sep/2024: Co-chairing the 5th Workshop on Heterogeneous Memory Systems (HMEM 2024), this time co-located with IEEE CLUSTER 2024. Jun/2024: Very happy to co-organize the 1st Workshop on Distributed Computing with Emerging Hardware Technology (EMERALD), co-located with SPAA/PODC 2024. Some research ideas where I'm currently working on Tiered page placement for CXL-based systems Read our ACM/SPEC ICPE 2025 paper on "Better Memory Tiering, Right from the First Placement" Check our talk at the HCDS workshop at ASPLOS/Eurosys 2025 We also got a best paper award at Inforum 2025 (national conference) With João Póvoas Persistent memory transactions running on latest-gen. hardware-transactional memory Our arxiv preprint "DUMBO: Making durable read-only transactions fly on hardware transactional memory" With Paolo Romano, Alexandro Baldassin, Daniel Castro Want to work with me? These smart students are currently working with me: Nuno Alves (MSc), Alexandre Bento (MSc), José Esteves (MSc), Diogo Pacheco (PhD), André Libório (MSc), José Póvoas (post-MSc), Tomás Simões (BSc). Take a look here to know about some possible thesis topics. Feel free to drop me an email.
